snippet: America added more jobs than expected, a pleasant surprise after months of bad news. But the underlying details from July ranged from unimpressive to outright discouraging.
abstract: Labor Department report finds that unemployment edged up to 8.3 percent in July, remaining in line with the general 2012 level; report shows that employers added 163,000 jobs, substantially more than had been expected; mixed report spurs substantial gains on Wall Street, but provides no clear insight as to the direction of the economy.
lead_paragraph: America added more jobs than expected, a pleasant surprise after months of bad news. But the underlying details from July ranged from unimpressive to outright discouraging.

headline.sub: Growth Higher Than Economists Had Been Expecting
headline.main: Hiring Picks Up in July, but Data Gives No Clear Signal
headline.print_headline: Hiring Picks Up, But Data Gives No Clear Signal
